website_summaries.verdict: One of the more popular names around and for good reason. Most say it's "just right" with the perfect mix of firmness, comfort, cooling, and support. We like the price, too.
pros: Memory foam ensures proper support and body weight distribution for those with back or joint pain
Very high overall value considering total cost
cons: Those that cannot step away from spring-based mattresses have opted for other Leesa models

website_summaries.verdict: A neutral-temperature, medium-firm mattress that works best for lightweight side sleepers.
pros: This supportive all-foam mattress inflates quickly to full size
Side sleepers will feel coolest on this mattress, while back and stomach sleepers will experience neutral to warm temperatures in many cases
cons: Sleepers over 240 pounds may sink too deeply into this mattress

website_summaries.verdict: Puffy's Lux mattress is a top-selling option that delivers superior comfort while it maintains temperatures that are ideal for sound sleep. 12-inch thickness is supportive and doesn't distribute motion for uninterrupted rest.
pros: Boasts 4 layers that work together to ease pressure points, support your body, and regulate sleep temperatures
The cooling gel layer is great for those who tend to sleep hot
Owners rave about improved sleep and reduced pain
Has a removable cover that resists moisture and stains
Enjoy a 101 night sleep trial and industry-leading lifetime warranty with your purchase
cons: Price is higher than some bed-in-a-box mattresses, but otherwise it's difficult to find consumer complaints about this premium brand

website_summaries.verdict: Heavier-weight sleepers who crave the plush comfort of an all-foam mattress will like this choice.
pros: Rated for sleepers up to 500 pounds, this mattress relies on adaptive foam rather than springs to provide support without being too firm or aggravating pressure points
A 10-year warranty and 100-night sleep trial boost consumer confidence
cons: Edge support is not that great, and some sleepers don’t like sinking so far into the mattress

website_summaries.verdict: A hybrid mattress with a superior mix of sleep technology. Available in different firmness levels.
pros: Multiple layers of support from steel springs, to multifoam, to a wool/cotton topper, essentially taking different parts of great mattresses and combining into one
We recommend the 'plush soft' firmness option for side sleepers
White glove delivery and excellent customer service and support
cons: Great for side sleepers, but those with chronic back or joint pain may want to opt for a full foam option

website_summaries.verdict: With its warm sleeping temperature and medium-firm, slightly bouncy build, this may be the perfect budget mattress for cold sleepers.
pros: An all-foam mattress with a layer of firmer foam on the bottom to provide support
Inflates quickly once unboxed so users can sleep on it the same night
Sleepers will find it warm on most nights but rarely hot
Soft foam top layer provides cushioned comfort
cons: Some heavyweight sleepers find this mattress far too hot, and some say the foam compresses too quickly

customer_reviews.title: It was good for about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This was definitely not a long term investment. Our new mattress (by another company) comes today after a year having this one. It was fine in the beginning, but nothing that would prompt me to recommend it. After a few months, it was stiff and had no give. For the last several months, my husband and I have been waking up with back pain, if we slept at all. If you like a very firm bed, this may be good for you, but be warned, it's very, very firm.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Tinsley

customer_reviews.title: Bad Decision in a Box
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful. I've had the bed about a year and it is already hollowed out where I sleep and I wake up each day with an achey back. They say there is a "warranty" but the "warranty" has been useless. Basically, you have to show that the bed is indented. The problem is that the bed does not indent, it just becomes incredibly soft, so when you get in, you sink into where there is no support. Since you can't show an indent, you can't use the "warranty". I spent a good amount of money on this bed and expected it to last; but one year out and I'm going to have to buy a new bed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: My Second One!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my first Tuft and Needle mattress, it was a little hard to get used to. But after a week it was great. And the thought of going to a mattress store and spending hundreds more was very unappealing. Now I love it so much I bought a second one for a guest bed. As usual it was perfect right out of the box. I do notice that mattress #2 is just a little more firm that #1 that I've been sleeping on for 6 months. So give it some time if it feels weird at first. I'll never buy a traditional mattress again. So grateful for this alternative!
customer_reviews.author: KennethCityMom

customer_reviews.title: Gave me back pain, refund was almost no hassle at all
customer_reviews.text: This mattress gave me back pain. I enjoyed laying in it (I thought) but after a full night's rest I had severe back pain. I gave myself several months to adjust but the pain wouldn't go away. I got my refund within 100 days contrary to what some one star reviews say. It is not impossible. You do not return the mattress, and must contact someone at amazon specifically. I got bounced around between a few people in chat, but once I got to the right person it was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Raff

customer_reviews.title: Too "spongy."
customer_reviews.text: Too "spongy" for me. Maybe it is because I've used conventional inner spring mattresses all my life, but I can't get used to the spongy feeling of this mattress. It is also very soft and my body tends to "sink in." As usual, Amazon was awesome and issued a full refund! P.S. When the mattress arrived, the box was tattered, ripped, and covered with dirt. This may be due to the shipping method used but it wasn't very impressive looking.
customer_reviews.author: dfoxer

customer_reviews.title: Worst bed ever!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is incredibly hard, uncomfortable, and you feel like you're going to roll off it if you get within 12" of the edge. I'm clueless how anyone ever gave this thing better than one star!. If it was easy to return, we would get rid of it. I can't believe anyone would ever like this mattress & question all the positive reviews - fake? Paid? I don't know, just know it's horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Too hard regret not returning it
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to like this mattress but it is just too hard, we regret not returning when we had the chance. We just wanted to give time to get used to it but it's actually causing us back pain. We also hoped it would soften over time but it didn't happen. If you like extra extra firm then this is for you otherwise maybe look into other options
customer_reviews.author: Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this mattress
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this mattress...more than anything. It hurts my back so bad that i had to start sleeping in my kids beds. Now, onto the hassle free returns. Today, UPS refused to pick up my mattress as its not in a box. How exactly am i supposed to fit this king size mattress back in the tiny box it came in? Now, UPS also gave me my tag and said i need to bring it to the facility. What a disaster. My suggestion is to only buy one of these mattresses if you know you surely won't be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Uselman

customer_reviews.title: Not a long term mattress
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2016, reviewing in 2018 Pros: inexpensive light/easy to move a couple of years of great sleep Cons: Short term purchase My husband and I have been waking up sore for the past few months, and decided to rotate the mattress to see if that would help. We immediately noticed a difference (not visibly) in that night’s quality of sleep. That means we had to rotate after a little under 2 years. Assuming this happens again, it looks like we’ll be replacing this mattress in another year and a half. Purchase this mattress if it won’t be used daily, or if you need a short term solution, but I wouldn’t recommend otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: ams149

customer_reviews.title: I was so excited for a new bed and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for a new bed and the reviews were promising, but after the first night I woke up over and over in so much pain. I tried it for a few weeks, and every night I woke up with pain down my spine and in my shoulders. My husband woke up in pain every morning as well. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli B

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and sleepless.....
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this mattress with much enthusiasm after seeing the really cool mysterious billboards everywhere (Mattress stores are greedy). I read the product reviews and comments as well before purchasing. But sadly it is just not a comfortable mattress and I am returning it. I write this review as I lay here yet another night tossing and turning on what feels like a slab of concrete. If you like sleeping on concrete, then this mattress is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was the worst mattress I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst mattress I’ve ever had. I kept it for 20 days to give it a fair chance, but my back and shoulders were giving me so much pain when I woke up every morning that I couldn’t handle another night. If you have a bad back I highly recommend you do not purchase this bed. It’s suppose to be soft and comfortable- I guess if you like sleeping on a board! I give it a 0 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for back sleepers.
customer_reviews.text: Too firm that lacks back support for back sleepers. It's literally a pain in the back. It's s Slow sneaky problem as the back discomfort doesn't come on immediately but after 1-2 weeks the you cannot make it through the night until you wake up with lower back pain. Going back to my softer latex mattress alleviated the issue immediately in one night. That mattress has its own issue. It lower and mid back pain isn't one of them. If your a back sleeper avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Wake up HURTING every day!
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as I hoped. Very firm, which I prefer, but I do not sleep well on this even after about 2 months. I wake up with a HURTING back every morning. I have ordered a foam topper and hope this might help but as for the mattress, it is a fail for me but what do you do? It is not so easy to get rid of a mattress!
customer_reviews.author: seabumb

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.text: 1 YEAR LATER. We ordered our mattress last December (it is now November); I wanted to wait to leave my review. This mattress has given us the most excruciating back pain of our lives! I sleep better on our couch! Amazon/Tuft and Needle should refund due to horrific bs reviews, not to mention the pain we now sleep with because we’re stuck with this mattress until we can afford a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Did not like. For my back
customer_reviews.text: Did not like. For my back, needing stabilization, this was soft and unsupportive. Return policy sounds good- but how can you get a vacuum packed mattress back into a relatively small box? (I gave it away). Expensive experiment..
customer_reviews.author: Renewed

customer_reviews.title: Great initially, then it will mess up your back!!  DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This was great initially, super comfortable! Very easy to unpack and setup and I didn't notice much of an odor. However, I'm noticing now that my back HURTS so bad when I wake up in the morning now, and I know it's because of this mattress. Nothing changed with my exercise routine or lifestyle that would explain the soreness. I'm not a person that is prone to back problems either. Definitely not recommending.
customer_reviews.author: G. Camp

customer_reviews.title: 2017 after suffering with the worst case of sciatica
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May, 2017 after suffering with the worst case of sciatica. I felt I needed to replace my old mattress. So I chose the Tuft & Needle after reading the reviews. The mattress is too soft and doesn't give me enough support for my lower back. Because the mattress is on the soft side, the sides are very soft. Sitting on the edge causes me to slip right off. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieG

customer_reviews.title: Firmer than previous mattress but getting good sleep
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to write a full review since thats been done many times over. Overall we really like the mattress. First off, It is firmer than expected. If I were to walk into a mattress store I likely would choose a softer mattress over this. However, I've had back pain in the morning for years and that's likely due to a softer mattress that doesn't offer enough support. Mind you I weigh about 160 lbs, my wife even less. I imagine if you weigh more, it may feel softer. Mattress is definitely slippery but nothing a little non slip material can't fixWe really like our metal bed frame as well after adding thin plywood(See other review).
customer_reviews.author: Shawn N.

customer_reviews.title: Mattress firmness does not last after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mattress about 3 months. It started off a nice medium firm. It has increasingly broken down to super soft. I called Tuft n Needle and the only thing they suggested was to buy a former topper. Disappointed by this. A mattress should last longer than 3 months without additional purchases. I did not save the box to return it. I live in an apartment, I dont know where I would have kept it. If you want a non supportive mattress, this is for you. If you want a medium firm as it is sold as, this mattress does not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth altmayer

customer_reviews.title: It lasted around 3 years
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bed at the end of 2017. It was wonderful for about 6-8 months. It then became increasingly difficult to get comfortable and the bed became softer. I have to put a pillow under the mattress to keep me from rolling off the side of the bed. I have never had back pain from sleeping before, but this was our first "new" bed since my last Denver Mattress lasted around 15 years. I am 5'10" and around 170 pounds. I do not like firm beds, but I think I am going to have to buy a much firmer bed. Looking to replace this bed now, it almost lasted 3 years. I can't take the back pain anymore.
customer_reviews.author: pat8409

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY especially if you’re a stomach sleeper.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the mattress would be great but it’s not. I’ve never had aches and pains after waking up until I started sleeping on this mattress. My lower back, hips, and knees are frequently in pain after sleeping. I’ve even put a memory foam mattress topper on the bed to provide a little comfort but it doesn’t work. As of late even my shoulders hurt. I have to sleep with a pillow under my shins to relieve some of the pressure. I’m going to look for another mattress at a mattress store and have the remove this one. I’m disappointed by that since this mattress isn’t cheap. But it’s so damn uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ZeeMa7

customer_reviews.title: too hot ... too hard ... avoid
customer_reviews.text: Sorry ... couldn't handle it ... we tried this in during winter time ... each of the 4 days we slept on this mattress i was up at like 4 am my torso and legs sweaty ... my wife found this mattress too hard and refused to sleep after 3 days due to back aches ... both of us became like zombies ... sleepy achy beings within 3 days ... had to bring back out old mattress and squeeze/pack this mattress for return to Amazon ... lets see if the return goes smoothly
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are good only because of the return policy! Mattress sucks
customer_reviews.text: Didn't inflatable as promised. Uneven and looks weird because edges are lifted. Piece of junk. Can't believe they charged 750 for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a little firm for my tastes (I'm a side-sleeper) ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a little firm for my tastes (I'm a side-sleeper). If I don't move much during the night, I will wake up a little sore. But for the price and ease of ordering/delivery, I'm super-satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R

customer_reviews.title: So. Much. Mold. :(
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this mattress now for a year and 4 months. It was amazing at first - and is still quite comfortable. But unfortunately it has grown quite a bit of mold on the bottom side of it. I live in the desert - humidity is practically non existent out here. I believe I have found the culprit for my horrendous headaches over the past few months. I’ve never had a mattress do this before. I am truly disappointed, as I had high hopes for this mattress/brand.
customer_reviews.author: crayola melted all over the floor

customer_reviews.title: Like sleeping on a rock.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this mattress. The cover is nice, so the mattress looks nice, but it is as hard as a rock. The bottom 3/4 foam layer is so hard that it completely wipes out the softer top 1/4. We have had it for almost three months now and I wake up every morning with sore muscles and a kink in my neck. I am a belly/back/side sleeper and this bed has made me toss and turn worse than I used to. I will be returning the mattress soon.
customer_reviews.author: nicedad

customer_reviews.title: Horribly bad mattress. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: Had this mattress since 2019. It has been the worst mattress we have ever bought. We have had foam mattresses before, this is bad, just bad. No support, sleeping in a marshmallow, mattress caved within months. It does not have enough foam to be functional. It is not thick at all, the sheets that should for it, come off because the mattress collapses so badly. You cannot sit on the edge of the mattress, there is nothing there, it just collapses. If I could save someone from ever buying this I would, for $600 this was the worst waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DBCooper

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it.
customer_reviews.text: If I would have reviewed this mattress 3 months after I bought it my review would have been 4 to 5 stars. Instead I decided to wait 9 months and this mattress gets 1 star. I wake up in the middle of the night because depending on how I'm sleeping either my back, hips or shoulders hurt. Sometimes all three hurt. I've always had some issues with my back which is why I bought this bed. Now I get to deal with achy hips and shoulders as well. I'm not sure which bed is the right one to get but I do know this is not the one.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Great med-firm mattress. Fantastic price for quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that this matter was wouldn’t be firm enough, but boy was I wrong. I haven’t slept so well in years - after having second hand mattresses for a long time. This one is just firm enough (not too firm, it has give) and it makes me so happy to sleep on. I am so happy with this purchase, I can’t praise it enough! And the fact that it wasn’t thousands of dollars astounds me. My partner’s mattress, which is a tiny bit too firm for me, is excellent and he paid almost 2k for it. For $500, this mattress is a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Raphael

customer_reviews.title: In long term I hate it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mattress for 9 months.. They say 30 days to get use to it..In long term I hate it...I wake up with more back pain than I ever ever did...I waisted my money on it.. I am a petite women an I don't sink in it like most people do.. I can not sleep no longer than 5 hours on it...I would not waist your money...long term it's just not what all the reviews made it out to be..
customer_reviews.author: Arisha McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Very firm
customer_reviews.text: I thought medium firm would be fine but it was really firm and didn't get much softer after the 100 day trial period was over. I put a memory foam mattress topper on top and it's fine now but a little disappointed in the brand. I was just above 200lbs when I first got it so it might be good if you weigh more than that. I've had it for about 4 years and I haven't noticed any sag in the middle like my other mattress yet so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great for those that like a firm mattress
customer_reviews.text: First the good - it is solid and supports amazingly well for a mattress only 10 inches thick. The fit and finish looks good and I detected little to no off-gassing. Also, it does not sleep hot which some do. The bad - it is FIRM. I mean, like laying on a board with a foam topper over it firm. I prefer a more firm mattress, but this is even too firm for me. I will give it a bit to see if it breaks in, but may have to resort to a eggshell foam topper or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Look at reviews from people who own it for more than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: this mattress is costing us more money from all the Rehab Therapies, Chiropractors and massage therapies. This mattress after a few months does not support your back. My wife and I have pain all the time in between our shoulder blades from this mattress. I know we could never return it but please don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: DJLIVING

customer_reviews.title: It's a gamble
customer_reviews.text: I had stayed over a friend's place and slept so well I asked her what mattress she had. I followed the instructions but the mattress barely made it to 9 out of 10" thick. The company said they would be nice and replace it once. The second one inflated a little less and was much firmer. I think that the quality really varies. My body started hurting again so I spent nearly $200 more to get mattress toppers, which were great. Unfortunately the mattress was ruined when my apartment got black mold recently less than a year after I bought it. This is a gamble I probably wouldn't take again.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie Copperton

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as (possibly better than) the Casper, and much less expensive
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy two Casper mattresses, but a paid ad from T&N claimed that they had originated the high-quality, low-cost mattress idea (shipped in a box), so I decided to buy one of each. I've slept mostly on the Casper. When I sleep on the T&N, it's at least as comfortable, maybe a little bit more comfortable than the Casper, and it was quite a bit less expensive than the Casper. Casper has now moved into the highly-overpriced segment of the market, so my advice is... get one from Tuft & Needle!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Toxic, maybe a little bit less than others... but still toxic
customer_reviews.text: T&N customer service and Amazon customer service were champs in dealing with this toxic VOC mess. I'm not sure what Certipur actually guarantees: this mattress stunk up the whole house, causing headaches, dry nostrils; it off-gassed like a champ! I thought this mattress would be a thrifty way to get a safe mattress. I was wrong; it's just toxic in some ways and not others. The potent stench of chemicals did not subside and after two weeks I contacted customer service to get a refund. They were friendly and easy to deal with!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: MOLD under mattress
customer_reviews.text: Loved this mattress. For the last few years it has been a dream. Very comfortable and best sleep I have ever had. I was really happy with this over the expensive box store mattress. But then we moved and I finally lifted the mattress over to see the most disgusting thing ever. Body sweat stains and tons of mold. We are very clean people and the top of the mattress looked brand new. We even used a mattress cover. I don't know what caused this but apparently this mattress does not jive well with regular box springs. It needs air between them. Think about this before buying one.
customer_reviews.author: CANCOOKER PRO

customer_reviews.title: Bad for your back
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these mattresses in June. I wanted a firm mattress because I have had back issues in the past. One of the reviews I read before buying said that over time my back pain would improve. I have had the mattress a little over six months and my back pain has persisted. I recently went on vacation for a week. Within a few days of sleeping in the hotel bed my back felt a lot better. I have been back home for two nights now and my back has been killing me all day. I wish I would have stuck with my Beautyrest.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Portlandia

customer_reviews.title: This is the bed!
customer_reviews.text: All right, you all. I spent hours upon hours looking at reviews and so on for beds when my old bed needed replacing. I finally decided on Tuft & Needle, though I felt uncertain. I almost went with Purple. I'm so glad I didn't. It's been six months and I have felt amazing sleeping in this bed. It's incredibly comfortable with good heat distribution. It has a good firmness/softness ration and I feel supported. It's also quite good for night-time activities as well. I highly recommend this bed. :) Shop around, but make sure you seriously consider this one. I'm very happy with my T&N bed.
customer_reviews.author: Auryn Vrvilo

customer_reviews.title: I don’t get the hype, and I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I just don’t get why people love this bed. Mine took forever to arrive, it was the bed in a box experience everyone knows of. The cover is cheaply made. It’s not especially comfortable. I’m generally a side sleeper and find this bed too firm for my shoulders and hips, it’s not as uncomfortable when i sleep on my back, but there is just nothing special about this bed. I debated on returning it during, didn’t, and now I really wish I would have. I just don’t think this is worth the price, hype, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Alisia

customer_reviews.title: I’d get better sleep on the floor...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mattress on Prime day, as I had been waiting to see if it would go on sale. I thought paying $600 was a great deal for a high rated mattress, but could not have been more wrong. The mattress is very firm (I typically like a firmer mattress) and has no give to it. Some nights were better than others but after a month I found I was actually missing my old worn out mattress. In short, this mattress is a piece of junk. I would rather sleep on the floor than on this. Amazon customer service rocked and refunded me my money, and didn’t even want the mattress back. What’s that tell you?!
customer_reviews.author: ttotheracy

customer_reviews.title: Too firm for my comfort
customer_reviews.text: While this mattress seems reasonably well made and didn't have an off odor, it's too firm for my liking. When laying on my side I need a second pillow to elevate my head as my shoulders don't really sink in. On my back, my butt doesn't sink in enough for me to get much (if any) support on my lower back. For reference, I'm 30, moderately active, a more muscular build with a little extra weight around the midsection. I used to prefer somewhat firmer mattresses, but it's possible my last mattress spoiled me (it was a queen-sized Dunlopillo latex mattress that was around $1,600).
customer_reviews.author: Corey Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great First Impression
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an 8-year old conventional coil spring mattress that was just wearing out. I checked the reviews, particularly Consumer Reports latest mattress tests and went this 'recommended for side sleepers model.' No problems with delivery and unwrapping. After a month of sleeping on it, both my wife and I are very satisfied with the comfort level. I was experiencing back and hip pain with my old mattress, but no more, all gone. I will say it keeps more body heat than our old mattress. So if you are sensitive to heat, this is probably a mattress to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: 10th Legion

customer_reviews.title: We went back to the old mattress in the spare room which was a linus purchased from Walmart a year ago (I now love this product)
customer_reviews.text: This thing killed my back. After allowing it to expand my first night 'sleep' took two days to recover from. We went back to the old mattress in the spare room which was a linus purchased from Walmart a year ago (I now love this product). Few days later we tried a 2" foam topper on this mattress with the same result though not as sever. Everyone has their own tastes but this thing was a long way away from working for us. I will donate or cut up into dog beds and give them away as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: jayj

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, Mattress wasn't for me BUT
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews on this mattress, I took the plunge and purchased my first "bed-in-a-box." At first, I thought I loved it, but after about a week or so, I noticed I was waking up NOT refreshed or rested. I developed lower back pain I've never had and would toss and turn all night because this mattress gets HOT. I would not recommended for a warmer climate (TX). As much as I wanted to love it, I did make the decision to return. Amazon was great with handling the return. A quick, friendly phone call to customer service and quick, friendly pick-up. Easy as pie.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for the Price
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased a queen size Select Comfort (sleep number) mattress 14 years ago, which was incredible. But last year we bought a house and had a kid, so we desperately wanted a new king size, without paying 4-5k. We bought a T&N king size for 700ish. For the price, even considering our previous awesome mattress, we both think this mattress is perfect. Would we buy another sleep number if we were flush in cash? Of course. But for at least the next few years we're satisfied with the general comfort, breathability, coolness, etc. The only thing we ever think about now - very very rarely - is the mattress itself.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed but VOCs are very strong!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the bed after moving to a new apartment. Quick shipping. Comes in tidy -- in a large box. Unpacking was easy. The bed is very comfortable and is the right firmness for me. It isn't too cushy. I don't like sinking into the bed. The biggest issue I had was the amount of time it needed to air out the VOC. It smelt very very strong. I couldn't sleep on the bed for some time. I had ordered a full size bed previously and that aired out quickly (maybe because of size). Even after a month of being unpacked, there's still a lingering smell. It could that my apt doesn't good air circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard
customer_reviews.text: Mattress came in a bag, not a box. Plastic was nicked through to the mattress in a few places. Amazon says sorry, send it back. It is not something you "send back ". Ordered another one from the manufacturer. It did come in a box, seems well made, but again, it's Hard. I'm too old to screw with returning big, heavy things. Wish I could find a way to choose a comfortable mattress with out all this hassle. Reviews, and a friend, recommended this, but after about 5 hours my hips hurt. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: S.L.

customer_reviews.title: but I'm annoyed that I have to deal with the whole return ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset. I purchased Twin XL as a gift and it arrived a few weeks before i needed it as planned. I opened it on the day off the occasion and it turns out that even though the box clearly says it is size twin XL, the actual mattress size is twin 39x75x10. I measured it 4 times since it didn't fit the base and the sheets. I don't know if someone made a mistake or it is done on purpose, but I'm annoyed that I have to deal with the whole return process and it can't even be used in the mean time. ugh, i was very excited and now I'm only annoyed
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: it's a great mattress which seems to cover the spectrum of comfort ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a great mattress which seems to cover the spectrum of comfort needs. One thing to watch out for is that it is very light weight and will shift on a box spring foundation; which requires periodic pushing back into position. Also, I would recommend not trying to set on the edge of the bed as there is no edge so to speak. I tired to sit on the edge to get dressed and nearly ended up on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Florida John

customer_reviews.title: Too firm for side sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so after reading a lot of reviews on a lot of sites I decided to try the King sized Tuft and Needle mattress. It seems like an equal number of reviews said it was too firm as those that said it was too soft. Well, I can tell you it’s a bit of both. I’ve slept on it for about 3 weeks now. When laying on my back it’s great - plenty of support but also soft and comfortable. I’m a side sleeper, though. And I’ve been waking up achy and sore in the mornings. It just needs about 15% more “give”. I’m hoping it will soften up a bit more after I’ve used it for a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: "illinokie"

customer_reviews.title: Easy return/refund
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely a FIRM mattress. Basically rock solid. I ended up returning it. The nice thing was due to it being used, they are not able to accept the return and I was able to donate the bed without having to do the whole return process, they just refunded me.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: NO free topper option for Amazon purchases
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this mattress. The price point was awesome, the customer service rated supreme. It's our first attempt at bed in a box but my back needed a change. Bonus, Amazon offered a payment plan. The biggest pull was knowing T&N would offer a topper if it wasn't comfortable enough. Well they don't offer that if you buy it through Amazon. We haven't even had it a month but it's just too firm for side sleepers. I'm on the fence between buying a $100 topper or returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Too firm
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are so upset, we spent quite a bit of time researching mattresses and finally decided to spend the money on the tuft and needle. We slept on it last night, and neither one of us got any sleep. This mattress is too firm, it felt like we were sleeping on concrete.. I have heard that I should try a topper, but don’t Really want to spend anymore money than we already have. So disappointed. I guess now we have to go through the process of trying to figure out how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: allison green

customer_reviews.title: Sadly I can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Been sleeping on this for about a year and it's far too soft. I ended up sleeping in another room for a couple of months as the mattress wasn't supportive enough. I'd find my husband in the morning stretched across the bed horizontally in an effort to get support for his lower back. We're average adults in our 50s so no special circumstances that could lead to discomfort. I ended up buying an expensive latex (extra firm) topper to try to mitigate the Tuft and Needle softness. Slept on it for the first time last night and slept better than I have since we purchased the mattress. So no, I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mc.

customer_reviews.title: This bed is best for back sleepers, who want a firm bed.
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to get the bed! We've heard great things, but the experience hasn't been the same as other people we know. The bed seemed comfy but each night, after a few hours, feels really firm and both my husband and I, are side and belly sleepers and cannot find a comfortable sleeping position. We've had the bed in use since early May and have been trying to find ways to sleep better. We understand there is a breaking in period for all beds. Now that it is warmer, we are waking up sweating from the mattress. We just purchased a mattress pad that should help with the firmness and heat issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ambrosia Ayde

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 09/2016. Constant back pain upon waking up since mid-2019
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September of 2016. Back pain started in 2019 and simply hasn't gone away. For awhile I thought it was just me, but recently my GF said it bothers her back as well. I'm 6', 220 lbs, and GF is 5'5" and athletic. If the bed doesn't work for either of our body types, that says a lot. I find most of my pain comes from sleeping on my side, but we are both known to start on our backs and awaken on our sides. Considering the price, I expected a lot more longevity from this mattress and brand. Notes: Bed is supported by a slatted frame. Sleeps hot. Spinning the mattress head to toe does not help.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: insanely comfy!!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress and a chiropractor will improve your (over 30 yrs old) life exponentially! My wife (snowflake millennial- 2 yrs younger than me) needed a soft cushy mattress. Myself - walked to school uphill in the snow and chopped wood all winter- needed a firm, black coffee kinda mattress. We bought this unsure of how it'd feel... but we both LOVE it! I'm not sure how it's soft and firm, warm and cool, etc. but it is!!! Highly recommended! Also.. you know... sex =)
customer_reviews.author: matthew davidoff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a long overdue review. I purchased this about 5 years ago, and it's the best decision i've ever made. My first adult purchase decision! It was recommended to me by a friend, and I was hesitant at first because I would have preferred to get a feel out of the mattress before buying it. But I went ahead and trusted my friend, took the plunge and bought it. BEST MATTRESS EVER! Even after having it for 5 years, it still feels like-new. I prefer firm mattresses but not to the point where it's super stiff. Tuft & Needle is perfect. I've had amazing sleep ever since and I absolutely hate getting out of bed. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: loved the concept of affordable mattresses without the cheesy mattress ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to make this mattress work...loved the concept of affordable mattresses without the cheesy mattress salesmen. Unfortunately, the bed was too firm for me. I tried adding a memory foam topper but it still was too uncomfortable for me. My husband liked it initially, but it became too firm for him as well. If you need a firm mattress, this is the one for you. Fast, simple delivery and setup. A fair return program is really important when buying mattresses online. Will follow-up and report how it goes for me.
customer_reviews.author: M Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Great for back pain!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bed!! I was a little hesitant to order a bed online, even with the 90 day trial. I am so glad that I decided to give it a try. I constantly have back pain, and this mattress is a life saver! It’s a little more firm than I am used to, however that seems to be the thing that is helping my back. If you are considering a new mattress I definitely recommend this one, great price and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Take the Dive
customer_reviews.text: we purchased 2 of the twin size on a black friday deal 3 years ago now, that being said, i don't think these have changed or degraded at all in that time. they are fairly firm, but man do we notice a difference when we spend a weekend away and sleep on a different mattress. We actually really like having our own bed, sheets, blankets, etc. even though we have two twins pushed together. I would definitely recommend even for married couples like ourselves, sleep is 99% of what you do there, the other 1% you will adapt and overcome to figure out lol. you just have to figure out who's side to do it on at that point.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mattress
customer_reviews.text: Seriously fantastic bed. 3 years and about 5 moves later, it’s still just as comfortable and in great condition. It’s firm but soft/soft but supportive. My husband and I are both around 6” and 159-190#. My parents have slept on it while visiting twice and love it - they’re 6’6” and 5’2”, so it’s very versatile as far as body weights, heights, and ages it’s comfortable for.
customer_reviews.author: Murch1jm

customer_reviews.title: We returned ours.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this mattress, but the comfort level just wasn't where we needed it to be. My wife and I never had a good night's sleep on this mattress. She was uncomfortable and I woke up every few hours with bad back pain which I never experienced with any other mattress. We slept on it for 18 nights and eventually started sleeping on the couches until we replaced it. I callled Amazon to pick it up and after 3 screw ups on their end they just gave our money back and told us to keep the mattress. That turned into its own headache to get rid of.
customer_reviews.author: Mikgyver

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: After Adam ruined the mattress industry for us, I spent months researching a quality mattress at a reasonable cost. Ultimately we chose Tuft & Needle because I was told that it's comfortable, yet would provide adequate support. I was afraid it would be too hard, but my line of thinking was, "If it isn't soft enough, we'll just buy a mattress topper." My husband and I both *love* this mattress. We've been using it for a few months now and we've decided that we're so happy with it that we don't even need a topper. And then, much to my husband's dismay (because of the cost), I bought Tuft & Needle pillows and sheets. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good Bed, But Too Hot
customer_reviews.text: Bought the T&N Queen Size from Amazon. It is a comfortable enough bed, but does not address the two reasons I bought it in the first place 1. Back Pain - I have lower pack pain when lying down, and this bed did not make it worse, but didn't help either 2. Sleeping Hot - this bed sleeps very hot. I guess it is "less hot" than memory foam, but still after 30 minutes I wake up hot. However, the return policy is great. No questions asked, I was able to return the mattress through Amazon. 5 stars for that
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rumsch

customer_reviews.title: Was nervous ordering a mattress online but very pleased with result.
customer_reviews.text: We bought three of these following a move to a new place. Everyone really likes them. They are fairly firm initially but are really comfy. I am a side and back sleeper, and this mattress suits me really well. They are also fairly cool feeling, which is very pleasant. When they arrived, we unwrapped them and let them sit for several days before initial use, so we didn't have any issues with under-inflated or misshapen mattresses, nor did we notice any unpleasant odors. Overall very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, affordable, and easy
customer_reviews.text: Ships quickly, pops to shape fast, and doesn't have the chemical odor of its competitors. Very comfy with a unique feel to it - very soft on top and firm at the bottom. You feel enveloped and supported at the same time. Overall, a good night's sleep. Would recommend using with a traditional box spring or bunky board and not a slotted bed support, as that option wasn't supportive enough. For the money, this mattress is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe the hype!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed two months ago and it is very uncomfortable especially if you have a bad back. There is no lumbar support. Your butt will sink in and leave your back sloping downward with no support and I am petite 125 pounds. I woke up with lower back pain. I don’t understand why everyone is saying this bed is so comfortable. It’s not!!! I called tuft and needle and they were no help. They offered me a topper for 40% off their price. Their toppers are expensive and who is to say the topper will work. No thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be more pleased 10 months in
customer_reviews.text: I have been sleeping on this bed for 10 months now. It has been worth every penny. I have significantly less back pain now. I’ve been sleeping better. And I really like the firmness of this mattress. You don’t sink into it, but you don’t feel like you’re laying on top of it either. It contours to every curve of your back. It’s holding up really well. I have it on an IKEA platform bed and there is no sagging where I typically lay in the middle. I’m 6’ 1” and with quarantine weight pushing 240 and it’s perfect. As soon as I get out of bed you can’t tell I was ever laying in it.
customer_reviews.author: FrankieSP

customer_reviews.title: Just do it. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new mattress. We debated mattresses for months and months. The 4-inch foam topper really seem to save the last spring mattress we had bought so going to a foam mattress was a high consideration this time. We've had the mattress for a couple of months now and we're both extremely pleased. The price point is fabulous and the construction is great. I can't think of a single complaint for this mattress and the way we talked about it to friends and family sounds like we get a kick back from the company. We don't. We just really love the mattress. I would easily replace all the mattresses in the house with if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny B. Good

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but firm for those with back issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for myself and my daughter. My previous mattress was a tempurpedic cloud that I paid $3500 for. In comparison, this is way better in terms of cost, spine support and it stays cool. The tempurpedic is very heavy, gets hot when you body sinks into it and for all those layers, doesn't give enough back support. Would wake up feeling sore and like back was going to go out. I have none of these issues with the Tuft and Needle mattress. So worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaGuy

customer_reviews.title: It's a really great option at this price point
customer_reviews.text: It's about as close to perfect as you can expect out of a box at this price point. Buy it with the topper. We didnt and ended up buying one for it. Makes a significant difference. I still have back and hip pain, but for $799 I didnt really expect it would fix it. It's definitely comfortable. Medium firm. I dont expect it to last as long as a more traditional mattress. We have had it a few months and there is a noticeable difference in the support already.
customer_reviews.author: michelle gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Firm but so good for back support
customer_reviews.text: Its a firm bed and getts somewhat softer overtime, it isnt like sleeping like a cloud and it isnt memory foam so you do not sink in like crazy my husband is 240 and 5’11 loves it! I am 150 5’5 and love it as well. i do not wake up with any back pain, infact i go to bed with an achy back and it disappears when i wake up, i do not toss and turn to adjust much. I have tried purple, nectar, temperpedic and tuft and dynasty and this. Tuft and needle and then purple is the best! NECTAT SUCKS , do not buy tht quick sand pieve of garbage. U will cry of pain!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: A little on the firm side
customer_reviews.text: Having slept on a Tempurpedic mattress the last several years I was curious how this would compare given the lower price. After one week of sleeping I can say it does well but not perfect. My wife says she feels every time I move but I don’t notice that from her. I was hoping it was going to be cooler, but I think it’s the same. It is a bit firmer but no aches when I get up in the morning. Overall pleased given the price, but if I had any complaint it would be that it’s just a bit too firm for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t inflate right and too hard for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this mattress after reading so many happy reviews. After waiting for over a week, the mattress didn’t fully inflate evenly. The mid section was high and top and bottom dipped. The mattress is very hard to lay on and there was minimal edge support. Customer service was great. I called amazon and asked for special handling department who arrange for UPS to pickup the next business day. The only catch is that you need to box the mattress up yourself. I folded the mattress in half and used my own cardboard to make a box for the mattress and LOTS of packaging tape.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Do

customer_reviews.title: Great, Great Bed!
customer_reviews.text: Had this bed almost a year now and can say it's the best bed I've ever owned. Its comfortable and does well at dispersing heat when it's hot but still can have me over heating in those hot CA summers. In the winter the parts you arnt sleeping ok can get very cold, but that's a plus for me since I run hot.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: My first pain-free night in ten years
customer_reviews.text: My mattress arrived yesterday, and I spent my first pain-free night in ten years. I'm so happy. I could spend the rest of my days in bed, except I always want the pleasure of that first moment of sinking back into my new mattress. I was a little disappointed when I first unrolled it. The mattress was much softer and squishier than I would have chosen if I'd gone to a store. Then I spent a few hours on it and I was in love. My kid doesn't want to leave it. My cat is thrilled with it. And I'm beyond delighted. There's no going back.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Voloudakis

customer_reviews.title: Extreme backpain for both of us
customer_reviews.text: I had read all of the reviews, I had done my research about what people found comfortable and what was good value. These guys were supposed to be the mattress that would be perfect and 3 months after the trail period and every day after my back pops in the morning and I find myself in severe pain. The better half experiences the same thing too. I travel a lot for work and I genuinely dread being home and dealing with the disappointing bed. It simply just does not support you at all, I have never had worse backpain than I have with this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't ship in box. Be prepared for stains. Also, be prepared for the best night's sleep of your life.
customer_reviews.text: I slept like a baby for the first time in YEARS the first night, last night. On a very stained mattress. Arrived in plastic, NOT a box. Plastic was ripped to pieces. I give it 5 stars for comfort. I was waking up with terrible pressure point issues, shoulders falling asleep, etc. This truly is the answer to my lower back issues too. I have no lower back pain. But, I really hate the stains!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value & Super Comfy
customer_reviews.text: This mattress provides some of the best bang for your buck. It's rated high on many top mattress review sites. Yes, there are some mattress brands out there that are better, but their cost ranges in the thousands. This mattress is super comfy, and there are diminishing returns for mattresses. I don't want to pay an extra thousand or 2 thousand dollars for that little bit of additional comfort. I also don't want to pay the price of a used car for a mattress. I might as well get the car and sleep in that, and partially fulfill my dream of having a race car bed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zh

customer_reviews.title: First few weeks review Edit now with one month.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few weeks now. While id does sleep way cooler than what I previously had. It is still to firm for my taste. I am in an honest debate to return it due to this. I do enjoy the cooler sleep and not waking all sweaty but I wake up way to often now do to the frim ness. Still not soft enough for my taste as a side sleeper. Added my old memory foam topper to it but then lost the well done cooling. Not sure what I want to do that this point. I am stuck with a good comfy hot sleep or a cool only sleep. Neither of which help me sleep.
customer_reviews.author: SandR0ck2003

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Delivery Issue: USPS refused to deliver to home saying it was too big. (It really wasn't that bad) First impression after one night: Pros: sleeps cool enough, very comfortable, good support, great for side sleeping, easy to roll over, woke up without back pain. Dimensions run on the tall side which I like, perhaps 1.5" taller than the average queen. Con: only one now, the edge support is poor, meaning if you are near the edge you might feel like you're tipping over and off the bed. I'm currently looking around for an aftermarket solution, but so far, ¡NO BUENO! If T&N addressed this I'm certain it would make the mattress notably more expensive and more difficult to ship ;(
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brown

customer_reviews.title: The box, and product, is very heavy. ...
customer_reviews.text: The box, and product, is very heavy. It would be helpful during setup if the "outer plastic" was a different color than the vacuum package. The inner package was damage while removing the outer plastic and we had to scramble to get the mattress laid out before it finished expanding. There may have been an indication which side of the mattress was the top, but we did not see it. The chemical smell only lasted about 18 hours and wasn't as strong as other brands. The mattress is quite firm and does trap quite a bit of heat. 20 minutes after someone had gotten out of bed I could still feel where they had been lying.
customer_reviews.author: A.Leone

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping well now
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit this mattress took a while to get used to- I'm used to innersprings. However, Now that I'm acclimated, I've been sleeping much better. It's not hot, and I'm not trapped into a position as I had feared. My only (minor) issue is that sometimes I find it a bit difficult to roll over. It's not like I'm stuck in a groove or anything- it's more like it's a little 'grippier' than the mattress I was used to. Full disclosure- I whip around like a tornado all night. LOL It was delivered quickly and was a cinch to set up. Takes a few hours to fill out fully, and never had an odor
customer_reviews.author: Stewy

customer_reviews.title: Nice at first but now agony
customer_reviews.text: Nice at first but now agony I bought this bed in July 2018. It was comfortable for about a year and then started to sag a little, so I started using toppers. But for the last few months my back has been in agony and there is a noticeable sag in the bed, toppers won’t fix it anymore. Not supposed to rotate it, not supposed to flip it, there is no way now to save that bed.I will check into tuft and needle’s 10 year warranty but no guarantee that it covers premature sagging I’m giving it three stars instead of two because it was comfortable for the first year.
customer_reviews.author: NW Dryad

customer_reviews.title: WISH I CAN RETURN THE MATTRESS.
customer_reviews.text: I developed acute back pain after some use. I called amazon after 1 month use and i was told since its new i need to give time for my body to adjust and now its ao bad i want to write a review. U fortunately i cant return this nor keep the mattress to use. I wish i did not purchase this product or had used my first call to initiate a return.
customer_reviews.author: jairam munuparthi

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over Sleep Number bed!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is such an improvement over the 7-year-old Sleep Number bed it replaced! We are sleeping better than we have in years with less back pain. At the time of writing, we've been sleeping on the mattress for just over a month. Shortly after purchase, my wife injured her hamstring and had surgery, so she's been laying in bed every day for the last 2 weeks recovering and says the bed is incredibly comfortable, doesn't cause any pressure points and is generally not something she thinks about during the day. There's honestly nothing to complain about - comfortable mattress, doesn't sleep too hot, zero problems with setting it up. Buy one - you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: KC Tech Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this mattress. I was afraid it wouldn't be "squishy" enough as she stated it was firmer than other memory foam mattresses. I have been sleeping on this mattress for about a month and I am in love! It gives enough to cradle my recently replaced hip but isn't so soft that I have to struggle to get out of the bed. I do have the mattress atop a set of box springs because I wanted the bed to be a little taller than it would have been with just the platform frame. I do wish there were handles on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: blondebutnotdumb

customer_reviews.title: Best Mattress Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well, we have slept on it for four days and so far we are sleeping the best we have in a long time. We have purchased so many mattresses over the last few years and I always end up sleeping on the couch because of pain from the pressure of the mattress. This was our final try to compromise and it worked. I will review again at 6 months and update.
customer_reviews.author: luvtoread

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I sleep like a baby in this mattress. Supportive and comfortable. Firm just the way I like but soft enough for my wife to be happy. I find myself going to bed and walking more restful than I have in years, sometimes I feel like I just closed my eyes with my alarm goes off. I have had chronic back pain and over I was able to actually pay in a bed after my last bout with disks I feel like this mattress helps to keep me more stable, especially as a belly sleeper, in fact I find I can even sleep on my side in this mattress, helping to prevent more back troubles down the line
customer_reviews.author: Spankinkopita

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Down Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for about two years now and I hate it. It started breaking down about 6 months after I got it and it can be extremely difficult to sleep on. Kicker? Because foam's degradation mode is in its stiffness, not it's shape, the magical guarantees based off of how much the surface sinks are useless. I would not buy this mattress again nor would I suggest anyone else buy it. The ONLY acceptable use for this mattress is in a guest room where it is used only a handful of times a year. Otherwise, you are stuck with a poor mattress that you have to replace yearly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping mattress I've used in years
customer_reviews.text: Should have done this sooner, have been sleeping on an older inner-spring mattress that had developed a sag due to repeated use. Many back issues that often worsened from sleeping on that mattress. Since switching over to the T&N mattress my back has felt better daily, I think I'm sleeping a lot better as well. No regrets except that I didn't try it sooner. Also, VERY reasonable price. Haven't owned it long enough yet to comment on longevity, expect from reading about it that I'll get at least ten years of use. At my age that's practically half the rest of MY life expectancy! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Robin D

customer_reviews.title: Undecided
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is very nice and was a great price. My concern with it is that it's very firm--which in itself isn't a problem. I prefer a very firm mattress. Yet this mattress has no contouring. It doesn't shape to your form to reduce joint pressure. We had an extra firm mattress for years that was perfectly supportive yet memory molded to your form, so that pressure was taken off the lower back, hips, and knees. Sadly, that manufacturer doesn't exist anymore, and the jury is still out on whether a plush mattress topper will remedy the concerns with this mattress.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Too firm for side sleepers!!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks after delivery before writing this because I thought the mattress would soften or expand more but the it's still giving me shoulder pain because of it's firmness. I sleep on my side so this mattress might not be right for side sleepers. They used to solve this issue by giving customers a free topper to soften the mattress. Now they give a 50% discount, which still comes out to around $80 for a full sized mattress. This is an annoying additional cost for a problem that should, in my opinion, be fixed without any additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ahamed Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Exxcellent replacement for old box springs/mattress set
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this mattress. It arrived well packed and compressed, and only took a few hours to open up enough to sleep on. Once aired out, there is no discernible smell to the foam. It has a padded cover and is firm enough for good support, but no so firm as to be uncomfortably stiff. I purchased a full size and wasn't sure 10 inches would be thick enough, but it is plenty big enough for one person, very comfortable and fits perfectly on the Zinus wood slat platform bed. I don't know about durability yet, but everything else so far is 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: itsizzi

customer_reviews.title: Easy transaction, a bit softer than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 10 yr old daughter's new loft bed. She's said it has been hot which could be due to a few things - the weather has been hot the past couple weeks, and we aren't using her ceiling fan as it is too close to the bed, or it could be the mattress... I slept on it too at the edge and felt it was too soft for me. The delivery was quick and packaging was good and there was very little smell to it so we are happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: lisa_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We had a $3000 Stearns and Foster that started giving us both back issues over the past year. Decided to go for a cheaper option so that if we hate it it isn't so expensive to replace. So we got the classic version of T&N. It took about a week for our bodies to get fully used to it. There were some cricks and pains the first week, but I've changed my mattress enough in my life to know that's normal. I must note that we also changed our pillows to cervical pillows and now our nights are comfy and dreamy.
customer_reviews.author: brooklynnicole

customer_reviews.title: I’ve seen the light! And it looks like a mattress!
customer_reviews.text: We recommend our Tuft & Needle mattress to anyone who stands still long enough to listen! This is actually our second one; we purchased a queen size a few years ago and recently upgraded to the king. I was skeptical about not only buying a mattress that comes in a box, but about a one-size-fits-all approach to fluffiness. I generally, in my dark mattress past, went for the softest available — oh, what a fool I was. This is perfect. We invite everyone who comes to our door to lay down on it, even rogue ding-dong-ditching teenagers, and everyone loves it. It. Is. Perfect. And cheap!
